qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: The pricing data source is obtained through our examination of each SaaS vendor's website according to the vendor list provided by the New Cloud Computing Showplace website
qualitative_analysis.justification: References SaaS vendors and cloud computing infrastructure as the delivery model for software business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: Application Types include CRM 8.8, Collaboration 8.5, Project Management 6.2, Marketing 5.3, Accounting/Financial 4.9, Document Management 4.9, BPM 4.6
qualitative_analysis.justification: Multiple application categories across different business functions indicate cross-industry applicability and B2B focus.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: Firm A develops planning and optimization software for telecom operators, offers both SaaS rental and traditional licensing with multi-instance architecture
qualitative_analysis.justification: Company offers both SaaS and traditional models (hybrid), uses multi-instance architecture, and targets enterprise telecom operators.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: Firm B provides interactive gaming platforms and games-on-demand services, using multi-tenant software architecture with revenue sharing model
qualitative_analysis.justification: Gaming platform with multi-tenant architecture and revenue sharing indicates gaming industry focus with service-based monetization.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: Firm C develops enterprise-SaaS for access rights management, serves financial institutions and government with both rental and licensing options
qualitative_analysis.justification: Enterprise SaaS targeting specific high-security sectors (financial and government) with hybrid pricing approach.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: Firm D develops 3D modeling software for furniture industry, uses pure rental model with multi-instance architecture, 90% customers prefer cloud
qualitative_analysis.justification: Pure rental (subscription) model with cloud preference indicates full SaaS adoption with industry-specific focus.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: Salesforce.com and Amazon, introducing the new business models and obtaining first-mover advantages; Salesforce.com cloud-based CRM software delivered over Internet as SaaS
qualitative_analysis.justification: New players with first-mover advantage in cloud-based SaaS delivery, establishing platform ecosystems.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: Microsoft and SAP are also making the transition to cloud-based business models; Microsoft with 'cloud-first design' strategy focusing on SaaS, PaaS and IaaS
qualitative_analysis.justification: Traditional vendors transitioning from on-premise to cloud models, maintaining hybrid approaches during transformation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: ERP Co - Nordic ERP vendor transitioning from on-premise to cloud-based SaaS business model for SME market
qualitative_analysis.justification: Established ERP vendor transitioning to cloud SaaS targeting small and medium enterprises.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Managing a Software Business
qualitative_analysis.quote: Will that be a pure software product, such as Microsoft Windows; a software–hardware combination (consider the iPhone); or a service, such as eBay?
qualitative_analysis.justification: Examples illustrate different business model types: traditional licensing (Windows), hardware-software integration (iPhone), and service platforms (eBay).

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Managing a Software Business
qualitative_analysis.quote: Netflix moving from posted DVDs to video streaming
qualitative_analysis.justification: Business model transformation from physical to digital streaming subscription, demonstrating digital transformation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Digital sustainable business models
qualitative_analysis.quote: LettUs Grow has digitally controlled farms that optimise resource usage through data analytics. Tado offers a digital automation service to ensure sustainable heating
qualitative_analysis.justification: Digital services focused on ecological sustainability using data analytics for resource optimization.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Digital sustainable business models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Octopus Energy uses a digital platform to make sustainable energy cheaper
qualitative_analysis.justification: Platform model enabling sustainable energy distribution with focus on environmental impact.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Digital sustainable business models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Arabesque offers a data analytics platform calculating sustainability metrics, carbon footprint, UN Global Impact Principles, ESG scores
qualitative_analysis.justification: B2B analytics platform monetizing sustainability data and metrics for enterprise decision-making.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: When does a freemium business model lead to high performance?
qualitative_analysis.quote: Arena of Valor is a MOBA game app with fragmented freemium model; allows players to purchase props and coupons based on interests
qualitative_analysis.justification: Free-to-play gaming with in-app purchases targeting individual consumers in mobile gaming market.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: When does a freemium business model lead to high performance?
qualitative_analysis.quote: Tencent Conference has a bundled freemium business model app, whose functional modules are bundled and sold; customers pay for membership to purchase bundled function modules
qualitative_analysis.justification: Freemium SaaS with bundled features and membership subscription targeting business users.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Strategy and business model evolution at Adobe
qualitative_analysis.quote: Adobe transitioning to subscription model
qualitative_analysis.justification: Major software vendor transitioning from perpetual licensing to cloud-based subscription model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Strategy and business model evolution at Adobe
qualitative_analysis.quote: Canva with browser-based creative software, Figma in user experience design
qualitative_analysis.justification: New entrants offering cloud-based creative tools disrupting traditional software with SaaS delivery.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Navigating the paradox of global scaling
qualitative_analysis.quote: Well-known examples of SaaS firms include Dropbox and HubSpot
qualitative_analysis.justification: Successful SaaS startups with global reach demonstrating cloud-based software delivery at scale.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Navigating the paradox of global scaling
qualitative_analysis.quote: Qualtrics and Netflix were 12 and 13 years old, respectively, before they started to scale globally
qualitative_analysis.justification: Companies demonstrating delayed but strategic global expansion as part of growth strategy.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Spillover Effects and Freemium Strategy in the Mobile App Market
qualitative_analysis.quote: Well-known examples include Dropbox, Evernote, LinkedIn, and Spotify. Freemium is a prevalent pricing model for mobile apps
qualitative_analysis.justification: Major mobile and web applications using freemium model with premium subscription options.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Systematic Literature Review of Monetization in Mobile App
qualitative_analysis.quote: 7 out of the top 9 apps fall within the freemium spectrum: Amazon, Facebook, Instagram, Messenger with ads and in-app purchases; Netflix with premium subscription; Spotify with ads and subscription
qualitative_analysis.justification: Dominant freemium model in mobile apps combining advertising, in-app purchases, and subscriptions.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Systematic Literature Review of Monetization in Mobile App
qualitative_analysis.quote: Vine failed in part due to its lack of a proper monetization plan
qualitative_analysis.justification: Example of failure due to inability to establish viable monetization strategy for digital service.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Current practices and emerging trends of transit apps
qualitative_analysis.quote: Five business models identified: private sector shared app (Transit App, Token Transit); white-label app with minor/major customization; in-house design vendor development; in-house development
qualitative_analysis.justification: Multiple B2B business model variations for transit software, from platform approach to custom development.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Stuck Inside a Cloud: SaaS business models and public market valuation
qualitative_analysis.quote: SaaS Index consists of: Salesforce, ServiceNow, Veeva, HubSpot, Atlassian, ZenDesk, MongoDB, and others
qualitative_analysis.justification: Portfolio of established B2B SaaS companies with cloud delivery and subscription revenue models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Managing Software-as-a-Service: Pricing and operations
qualitative_analysis.quote: Apple Music/iTunes for music streaming and digital music distribution with pricing and bundling strategies
qualitative_analysis.justification: Consumer platform with subscription model and bundling strategies for digital content delivery.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Managing Software-as-a-Service: Pricing and operations
qualitative_analysis.quote: Netflix with subscription pricing, recommendation systems, churn reduction, and network effects
qualitative_analysis.justification: Subscription streaming service leveraging network effects and data-driven recommendations while managing customer retention.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Managing Software-as-a-Service: Pricing and operations
qualitative_analysis.quote: Salesforce.com: Platform business model, CRM, third-party app ecosystem
qualitative_analysis.justification: SaaS platform enabling third-party ecosystem through APIs and app marketplace.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Managing Software-as-a-Service: Pricing and operations
qualitative_analysis.quote: Adobe Creative Cloud: Transformation from OTS to SaaS, bundling strategy
qualitative_analysis.justification: Major vendor transitioning from one-time sale to cloud subscription with service bundling.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Converting free users to paid subscribers in the SaaS context
qualitative_analysis.quote: Many software companies such as Microsoft and Salesforce have adopted the SaaS model
qualitative_analysis.justification: Major software vendors adopting SaaS subscription model, representing industry transformation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Optimal distinctiveness across revenue models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Zoom offers a free version with limited duration and participants; paid versions permit more participants and longer calls
qualitative_analysis.justification: Freemium SaaS with tiered pricing based on usage limits and value delivered to different customer segments.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Optimal distinctiveness across revenue models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Clash of Clans offers variety of upgrades and add-on features users can purchase to augment the free version
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobile gaming with freemium model monetizing through in-game purchases and upgrades.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: On top of the game? Social features in freemium products
qualitative_analysis.quote: Skype with free base service and paid calling credits; Tinder with free base service and paid Super Likes; Fortnite with free base game and paid cosmetic items
qualitative_analysis.justification: Consumer freemium models with free core service and paid enhancements, leveraging network effects.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Toward Building Specialized Information Systems as Software Platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: Learning from history of Salesforce, SAP, and Amazon in building successful software platforms
qualitative_analysis.justification: Enterprise platforms demonstrating successful ecosystem building through APIs and platform architecture.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Development of service-dominant business model for CAE software
qualitative_analysis.quote: Moldex3D implementing service-dominant business model; Autodesk Moldflow with public cloud services
qualitative_analysis.justification: CAE software vendors transitioning to service-oriented cloud delivery model from traditional licensing.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: MintM: the start-up transforming businesses real-time
qualitative_analysis.quote: MintM's cloud based smart signage solution product 'Magnet' serving brands such as Abbott, ITC, Nestlé, Nivea, Pepsico
qualitative_analysis.justification: Cloud-based B2B SaaS for digital signage with data analytics serving enterprise clients.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business model innovation in mobile apps market
qualitative_analysis.quote: Google Play Pass and Apple Arcade as examples of existing subscription plans for mobile apps
qualitative_analysis.justification: Platform-level subscription services aggregating multiple apps for unified pricing model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Competition Among Proprietary and Open-Source Software Firms
qualitative_analysis.quote: Confluent built business on Apache Kafka services; SugarCRM as OSS originator, Salesforce as proprietor
qualitative_analysis.justification: Open source software commercialized through service offerings competing with proprietary platforms.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business Case for Journey Planning and Ticketing App
qualitative_analysis.quote: Trav.ly app developed for West Yorkshire; examples include Whim (Finland) and Skedgo (Australia)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobile mobility-as-a-service platforms integrating multiple transport options for consumers.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Hypothesis-driven Adaptation of Business Models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Analyzed to-do apps: Microsoft ToDo, Wunderlist, Any.do, Todoist with various business model decisions
qualitative_analysis.justification: Productivity apps with freemium models demonstrating diverse business model configuration options.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: E-business evolution: analysis of mobile applications' business models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Spotify revolution in music sector through free-based business model
qualitative_analysis.justification: Digital transformation of music industry through freemium streaming model disrupting traditional distribution.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Cloud-Based Software Marketing Strategies Using Cloud Marketplace
qualitative_analysis.quote: AWS Marketplace with 7213 services; Korean companies like Daou Office, Hancom Space registered on AWS Marketplace
qualitative_analysis.justification: Cloud marketplace platforms enabling software distribution and discovery for business customers.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Software as a service: Lessons from video game industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: World of Warcraft released 2004 as one of first GaaS; Origin by Electronic Arts with subscription service (Origin Access)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Gaming as a service with subscription model pioneering SaaS approach in entertainment software.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The SaaS Payoff: Measuring Business Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: Personal use SaaS: Gmail, Skype, Dropbox; Business-centric SaaS: Salesforce CRM, SAP Analytics Cloud, Oracle ERP Cloud
qualitative_analysis.justification: SaaS models spanning both consumer and enterprise markets with cloud delivery infrastructure.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Searching for synergy from combination of heterogeneous business models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Polish SME companies with generic business models INT and VAR
qualitative_analysis.justification: Small and medium software enterprises combining different business model approaches.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business Models for Emerging Technologies: Affective Computing
qualitative_analysis.quote: Large corporations like Amazon, Google, Facebook, Apple along with domain-specific startups such as Affectiva and Crowdemotion
qualitative_analysis.justification: Emerging technology with both established platforms and startups competing through data-driven approaches.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Economics of open source library software
qualitative_analysis.quote: Koha, DSpace most favored OSS; ByWater Solutions, LibLime as service providers; Red Hat earns revenue by facilitating technical support
qualitative_analysis.justification: Open source software monetized through professional services and technical support for business customers.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Making Business Out of Predictive Application Management in Fog
qualitative_analysis.quote: CISCO providing Fog Director for application management; Dell producing hardware and IaaS solutions; Nebbiolo Technologies pioneering Fog-tailored hardware
qualitative_analysis.justification: Infrastructure providers and startups building fog computing platforms for enterprise IoT applications.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Synergies between App-Based Car-Related Shared Mobility Services
qualitative_analysis.quote: Uber with P2P model, dynamic pricing, commission structure; Lyft combining singular and shared options; car2go by Daimler, BlaBlaCar with 17% commission
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobility platforms facilitating peer-to-peer and B2C transactions through mobile apps with commission-based revenue.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Open source ERP business model framework
qualitative_analysis.quote: Compiere with 1.2M downloads and 100+ partners; OpenBravo with 82 participants and 970,000 downloads; Red Hat corporate distribution model providing support services
qualitative_analysis.justification: Open source ERP systems monetized through partner networks and service contracts targeting businesses.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Open source ERP business model framework
qualitative_analysis.quote: SugarCRM: Freemium model with basic free and paid proprietary versions; MySQL: dual licensing model
qualitative_analysis.justification: Open source software with dual licensing and freemium strategies combining free and paid offerings.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Analysis of Freemium Business Model
qualitative_analysis.quote: Alibaba/Taobao.com: free shop opening, paid decoration features (1.1 trillion yuan sales 2012); Tencent QQ with 848 million active accounts
qualitative_analysis.justification: Massive platforms using freemium with network effects, monetizing through premium features at scale.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: E-business models' value retention for start-ups
qualitative_analysis.quote: Hydration App with smart cup monitoring water intake; Sensor-enabled basketball App providing virtual coaching; Vehicle fleet tracking App with On-Board Diagnostic systems
qualitative_analysis.justification: IoT-enabled mobile apps monetizing sensor data and analytics for consumer and business applications.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Growth of platform business model as entrepreneurial ecosystem
qualitative_analysis.quote: Google Play (Android market) with open platform approach; Apple App Store with more closed platform approach
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobile app platforms with different openness strategies managing developer and user ecosystems.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Developing enterprise social software in China
qualitative_analysis.quote: Mingdao providing ESS via SaaS in China; Yammer acquired by Microsoft for $1.2B; Slack raised $43M in 3 months
qualitative_analysis.justification: Enterprise social software delivered as SaaS with subscription models attracting significant venture investment.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Open source - Is it alternative to intellectual property?
qualitative_analysis.quote: JBoss offers support services and tools; Red Hat revenue from Linux maintenance and consulting; Canonical provides commercial support for Ubuntu-Linux
qualitative_analysis.justification: Open source software companies generating revenue through professional services and support contracts.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Difficult Business Models of Digital Business Platforms for Health Data
qualitative_analysis.quote: RHIS platform for health data exchange in Finland; Examples include Alibaba, NASDAQ, OpenTable, Uber, YouTube, Facebook as successful platforms
qualitative_analysis.justification: Healthcare data platform learning from successful multi-sided platforms leveraging network effects.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Onboarding customer companies to electronic invoicing platform
qualitative_analysis.quote: Tieto as large international e-invoicing service provider with 200,000 active trading partners operating for two decades
qualitative_analysis.justification: B2B invoicing platform with strong network effects from large trading partner base.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: How Service Offerings and Operational Maturity Influence HIE Viability
qualitative_analysis.quote: Indiana HIE (IHIE) grew from 12 hospitals to 106 hospitals; HealthBridge using hybrid revenue model (85% subscription, 15% premium services)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Healthcare information exchange platforms with subscription and value-added service revenue models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Mobile ticketing services in Northern Europe
qualitative_analysis.quote: Ruter (Oslo) with >40% mobile ticketing share; Multiple providers: Accumulate, Payair, Nets, PayEx, Seamless, WyWallet as payment processors
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobile ticketing ecosystem with multiple stakeholders including transit operators, payment processors, and technology providers.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Effect of free sampling strategies on freemium conversion
qualitative_analysis.quote: Dropbox: 2GB free, 1TB paid, uses free trials; Spotify: free with ads, premium ad-free with offline mode
qualitative_analysis.justification: Freemium services with tiered value proposition and free trials to convert users to paid subscriptions.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Give Away Your Digital Services: Leveraging Big Data
qualitative_analysis.quote: Facebook with 1.7 billion users, revenue from advertising; Google services funded by advertising and data; Twitter selling tweet database access for ~10% Q3 2015 revenue
qualitative_analysis.justification: Free consumer platforms monetizing through advertising and data trading, leveraging massive user bases.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Give Away Your Digital Services: Leveraging Big Data
qualitative_analysis.quote: Strava selling cycling data to transportation departments for $20k/year; Nike Running to understand shoe usage
qualitative_analysis.justification: Free fitness apps collecting user data for product development and selling insights to third parties.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Making Digital Freemium Business Models a Success
qualitative_analysis.quote: Data from two online real-time strategy games and one dating platform; 94% free apps in top-grossing iPhone apps with 97% offering in-app purchases
qualitative_analysis.justification: Freemium dominance in mobile market with in-app purchases as primary monetization for games and platforms.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Understanding influence of absorptive capacity on business model change
qualitative_analysis.quote: Six incumbent ERP vendors (AlphaCo-ZetaCo) transitioning from on-premise to SaaS; Salesforce successful with single ERP function cloud solution
qualitative_analysis.justification: Traditional ERP vendors facing disruption from cloud-native competitors, struggling with business model transformation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: ERP Co: Nordic ERP vendor for SMEs transitioning from on-premise to SaaS, 6000 employees, 800M NOK revenue
qualitative_analysis.justification: Medium-sized ERP vendor managing transition to SaaS targeting SME market with significant revenue transformation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business models and opportunity creation
qualitative_analysis.quote: G-cluster develops interactive cloud gaming platforms and games-on-demand services, established Finland 2000
qualitative_analysis.justification: Cloud gaming startup pioneering games-on-demand service model with platform approach.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Revenue models, in-app purchase, and app performance
qualitative_analysis.quote: Top developers: Apple, Disney, Electronic Arts, Gameloft, Zynga; Garmin, Marvel Entertainment, Norton, TomTom with huge popularity
qualitative_analysis.justification: Major app developers across gaming, productivity, and specialized tools using various mobile monetization strategies.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Commercialization of Composite Software from Collaborative Research
qualitative_analysis.quote: FP7 project consortium: six partners (3 SMEs, 1 university, 2 research centres) providing video enrichment solution
qualitative_analysis.justification: Collaborative research consortium commercializing composite software through multi-partner ecosystem.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Adjusting software revenue and pricing strategies in cloud era
qualitative_analysis.quote: Five case firms: Firm A (telecom software), Firm B (gaming platform), Firm C (financial risk management), Firm D (access rights), Firm E (3D furniture)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Multiple software firms adjusting pricing strategies when transitioning to cloud delivery models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing business models for cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: Salesforce.com/Force.com: application-centric PaaS; Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, IBM Bluemix: comprehensive PaaS solutions
qualitative_analysis.justification: Platform-as-a-Service providers enabling third-party development through APIs and cloud infrastructure.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business Models for Cloud Computing: MSaaS Applications
qualitative_analysis.quote: EUROBIOS using ASCOMP's TransAT software; CloudBroker Platform for multi-cloud management; IaaS from MTA SZTAKI, BIFI, CloudSigma, Amazon
qualitative_analysis.justification: Modeling and simulation software delivered as service over cloud infrastructure with multi-cloud support.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Study on Decentralized SaaS Business Model
qualitative_analysis.quote: Amazon AWS server emergency incident in centralized model
qualitative_analysis.justification: Discussion of centralized cloud infrastructure challenges motivating decentralized SaaS approaches.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: Firm A: telecom operators software; Firm B: gaming platforms; Firm C: enterprise-SaaS access rights; Firm D: 3D modeling furniture
qualitative_analysis.justification: SaaS providers across different industries selecting appropriate revenue and pricing models for their markets.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Service-Centric Business Model in Cloud Environment
qualitative_analysis.quote: Webank: internet banking with online process based on cloud; Haier: electronics manufacturer providing one-stop services; Suning: retailer adapted traditional BM in cloud
qualitative_analysis.justification: Traditional businesses transforming to cloud-based service models across banking, manufacturing, and retail.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing Viable Multi-sided Data Platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: 3cixty data platform for mobile context-aware travel applications
qualitative_analysis.justification: Multi-sided platform leveraging location and context data for travel applications.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Economic and business perspectives on smartphones as multi-sided platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: Apple iOS with iPhone platform success; Google Android with open source platform strategy; RIM BlackBerry with enterprise email focus
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobile OS platforms with different openness strategies building developer and user ecosystems with network effects.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Crushing Candy: Free-to-Play Game in Connective Commodity Form
qualitative_analysis.quote: King Digital with Candy Crush Saga generating 78% of revenue; Zynga with FarmVille and CityVille; Rovio transitioning to free-to-play
qualitative_analysis.justification: Social and mobile games leveraging free-to-play model with in-app purchases and social network effects.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Effects of Freemium Strategy in Mobile App Market
qualitative_analysis.quote: Google Play as primary marketplace; Apple App Store, BlackBerry App World, Windows Marketplace as comparative platforms
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobile app marketplaces facilitating freemium distribution across different platform ecosystems.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Network Externalities, Incumbent's Competitive Advantage
qualitative_analysis.quote: Linux operating system and Apache Web server as OS products; IBM, Oracle and Sun Microsystem embracing open source
qualitative_analysis.justification: Open source platforms with network effects adopted by major incumbents as strategic business model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Clarifying Value Elements of Business Models for Disturbance Management
qualitative_analysis.quote: Company Alfa develops disturbance management service; ERP systems as competing solutions
qualitative_analysis.justification: SaaS-based logistics service competing with traditional ERP systems in supply chain management.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Impact of Open Source Software Commercialization on Firm Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: Linux, Apache and Debian as OSS projects; Major producers: Microsoft, Adobe, Novell, Autodesk, Intuit, Symantec
qualitative_analysis.justification: Open source projects and traditional vendors exploring commercialization and business model integration.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Relationship between Open Innovation and Strategy
qualitative_analysis.quote: Apple App Store open application model; Google Android open platform; Vodafone open partnering; Nokia open innovation through Ventures Organization
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobile platforms using open innovation strategies to build developer ecosystems and partner networks.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Better Understanding of Dynamics of PaaS Business Models
qualitative_analysis.quote: 4CaaSt EU-funded PaaS platform; AWS Elastic Beanstalk, Google App Engine, Microsoft Windows Azure, Salesforce Force.com, VMware Cloud Foundry
qualitative_analysis.justification: Platform-as-a-Service offerings enabling application development and deployment on cloud infrastructure.
